intro: Licania diegogomezii, commonly known as the Diego Gomez's licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
